title: Variational Free Energy and Information Theory
description: Mathematical derivation and analysis of variational free energy from information theory and probability theory.
learning_objectives: Derive variational free energy from first principles
Understand the relationship between free energy and surprise
Apply variational methods to approximate inference
Analyze convergence properties of variational algorithms

content.overview: Variational free energy provides a tractable objective for approximate Bayesian inference. It bounds the log model evidence and enables efficient computation in complex probabilistic models.

mathematical_derivation.variational_lower_bound: log p(x) ≥ E_q[log p(x,θ) - log q(θ)] = -F[q]

variational_free_energy_components.expected_energy: E_q[log p(x,θ)] = expected log joint probability
variational_free_energy_components.entropy: H[q] = -E_q[log q(θ)] = entropy of variational distribution
variational_free_energy_components.free_energy: F[q] = E_q[log p(x,θ)] + H[q] ≤ log p(x)
variational_free_energy_components.interpretation: Free energy balances model fit and model complexity

kl_divergence_formulation.interpretation: Difference between log evidence and free energy equals KL divergence
kl_divergence_formulation.minimization: min_q F[q] = max_q log p(x) - D_KL[q || p(θ|x)]
kl_divergence_formulation.optimality: Optimal q(θ) = p(θ|x) when F[q] = log p(x)

gradient_flows.fixed_form: For fixed q form, update natural parameters
gradient_flows.convergence: Gradient descent converges to local minimum

examples.name: Gaussian Variational Approximation
examples.model: p(x|θ) = N(θ, σ²), p(θ) = N(0, τ²)

examples.name: Mean Field Approximation
examples.iteration: Update each q_i while holding others fixed

information_geometric_interpretation.fisher_metric: g_ij = E[∂_i log p ∂_j log p]

convergence_and_optimality.rate_of_convergence: Depends on curvature of free energy landscape
convergence_and_optimality.coordinate_ascent: Block coordinate ascent for factorized approximations

connections_to_other_frameworks.expectation_maximization: EM as variational inference for latent variable models

interactive_exercises.description: Derive variational free energy from Jensen's inequality
Compute gradients of free energy for simple models

common_misconceptions.misconception: Variational free energy equals log evidence
common_misconceptions.clarification: Free energy bounds log evidence, equality only at optimum

common_misconceptions.misconception: More flexible q always gives better approximation
common_misconceptions.clarification: More parameters can lead to overfitting and higher variance

common_misconceptions.misconception: Variational methods always find global optimum
common_misconceptions.clarification: Only guaranteed for convex optimization problems
